p: In addition, Bojkova et al. recently identified the host cell pathways modulated by SARS-CoV-2 infection and revealed that suppression of these pathways may prevent viral replication in human cells [65]. Of note, SARS-CoV-2 infection profile was determined by translatome3 and proteome proteomics at different times after infection, suggesting that this virus could reshape central cellular pathways ( e.g., translation, splicing, carbon metabolism and nucleic acid metabolism) [65]. Accordingly, spliceosome inhibitors and glycolysis inhibitors may also be the potential targets.
